intro: Hieracium petiolosum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with upright, hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by petal-like rays, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium petiolosum is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
